intro: Stephanophysum hirsutum, commonly known as the hairy stephanophysum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in dry, rocky environments. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
